intro: Picea abies f. pyramidata, commonly known as the Pyramidal Norway spruce, is a compact, coniferous evergreen shrub or small tree. It is a form of the Norway spruce (Picea abies) and is characterized by its narrow, pyramidal shape and dense foliage. The leaves are needle-like, dark green, and arranged in spirals along the branches. It is native to the mountainous regions of Europe and is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its striking appearance. This variety is highly resistant to wind and can thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
